result.execSummary:
The defendant Wally Sostre Rivera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine/DNA Surcharge to be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 10/15/2016 or penalty of 7 days Huber for non-payment.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Defendant Wally Sostre Rivera in court with attorney Anthony J Procaccio.  Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Procaccio makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  

The Court Orders the Following to count #1:

FINE: $505.00

DNA Surcharge: $200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid at the rate of $50.00  per month commencing 10/15/2016.  Failure to pay;  the Court orders the defendant to serve 7 days in Huber
